text:
Hi guys, I've decided that since I haven't
done a question and answer in a little while
that I would do one.

I changed the environment a little bit because
I know some of you told me to get away from
that green screen.

There is a lot of green around me, but it
is grass and trees and it is fall.

There is actually a squirrel above me dropping
something.
It is mushy.
It smells weird.

I do not know, but he is dropping these on
my head.

The first question is from PuffPuff Sparkle,
and you asked: I know it is a bit of trouble

answering this, but I would really appreciate
your help.

I plan to travel from the UK to Morocco to
Jordan to Israel to Madagascar to Indian to

Nepal to Bhutan to China and then down to
South East Asia.

I was curious if I could get a around the
world ticket for this?

Everywhere I have looked only specializes
in a few countries and I ideally want to include
them in all one nice package.
What sites would you recommend?

I would recommend going with one ways because
that is a very long trip and the more countries

you add on when you are booking a round the
world ticket is going to cost you a lot more
because it is more complicated.

For a trip like that you also may change your
mind.

Maybe you will want to stay in Nepal, India
or Madagascar longer.

If you get a round the world ticket, you have
to book in advance and know the dates of when
you are going to be travelling to each country.

If you change your mind, it's going to cost
you quite a bit.

If you book one-way tickets, you a free to
do as you like.

You can stay in one country longer than another
or perhaps you will not want to stay in a

country as long as you thought you would and
you want to continue on.

It is going to be a lot simpler, easier and
less money if you book one-way tickets.

The website that I always use when booking
my flights is Kayak.com.

It literally takes all of the airlines and
finds you the cheapest ticker to your destination.

Then you can book it and there you go, you
got the cheapest flight on the Internet.

So to simply answer your question: book one-way
tickets, use kayak.com, and highly recommend
this!
The next question is from utubeuser1971aok.

That is probably one of the most difficult
names I have had to say in one of these videos,
so thanks for that.

Where is the most beautiful place you have
ever visited and if you could live anywhere
in the world right now, where would it be?

That is a very difficult to answer because
every place is beautiful in its own way.
That may seem clich√©, but it is true to me.

I always find beauty everywhere I go, so this
is very difficult.

Every place is so unique and has its own characteristics
and specialties and is beautiful in its own
way.

However, I would say, and you guys hear me
mention this country all of the time because

its my favourite, India stimulates all of
your senses at once, and I have never experienced

that in another country, I would say India
has made the most impact on me when it comes
to beauty and everything else all at once.

If I could live anywhere right now, where
would I live?

I am pretty happy living in Toronto right
now.
I love the city.

I have been to a lot of cities in the world,
and Toronto is till one of my to favourites.
There is a lot of opportunity here.

For the reason that I am an actress as well,
I like to balance my time between travelling
and acting.

I think Toronto is a great place for me right
now.

In the future, I would actually like to live
in Thailand.

I would love to live in Thailand because it
is beautiful and affordable.

You can get a lot for the Canadian dollar
there.

I can have my own garden with fruit trees
and live off the land, which is one of my
dreams.
The next question comes from James Sarigiammidis.
I know I said that wrong.
Sorry.
Hello Kristen, I need your opinion.

I am planning my first long trip and because
I am a big fan of camping and cycling, I am

thinking of combining all of these into a
totally free trip, except for food.
What do you think?

Is it possible to travel Europe with money
just for your food?
I say, absolutely!
Anything is possible.
I would think that would take more planning.
You can do some couch surfing too.

You said you like camping, so bring your tent,
but leave the option for couch surfing open.

Maybe one night there will be a thunderstorm,
and some kind traveller in Europe somewhere
will say come and stay with me.

Couch surfing is a good organization/website/community
to become part of.

I believe that the more budget your trip is,
the more exciting it becomes and the more
adventure you will have.

I think that is going to be an incredible
trip.

I would say check out places where you can
camp and see whether it is legal to camp randomly
or if you have to pay a fee.

That could be an issue if you don't want to
pay for accommodations.

I am sure you can find some places, even if
it is illegal, ti hang out for the night...secretly...in
a bush somewhere.

Another think I would recommend spending money
on is travel insurance.

I know you want to just spend money on food,
but I would recommend getting travel insurance,
especially for an adventure like that.

I hope you enjoyed this video and I answered
some of your questions.

If you have a question you want answered,
leave it in the comment box below or on Facebook,
Twitter, Email or on my website.

You can find all the links in the description
box below.

I swear there is a squirrel that is going
to drop something on me.
I will see all of you travel addicts later.
